maml:description.maml:para: A cmdlet to link an App to Android Intune MAM policy Azure resource.
A cmdlet to link an app to Android Intune MAM policy Azure resource.

SYNTAX Add-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicyApp -Name <String> -AppName <String> [-PassThru [<SwitchParameter>]] [-InformationAction <ActionPreference>] [-InformationVariable <String>] [-WhatIf [<SwitchParameter>]] [<CommonParameters>]

<CommonParameters> This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).
The Android policy name.
The Android App name to link to.
If specified will write true in case operation succeeds. This parameter is optional. Default value is false.
The Android policy name.
The Android App name to link to.
If specified will write true in case operation succeeds. This parameter is optional. Default value is false.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Add (link) a Android App to the Android Policy --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: After logging-in as a valid Intune Account, when this command is executed, this will add (link) the specified app to the Android Policy. After the command is executed, it will display the status.
If any parameters are wrong, it will display "BadRequest" error message.

maml:description.maml:para: A cmdlet to link a Group to Android Intune MAM policy Azure resource.
A cmdlet to link a group to Android Intune MAM policy Azure resource.

SYNTAX Add-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicyGroup -Name <String> -GroupName <String> [-InformationAction <ActionPreference>] [-InformationVariable <String>] [-PassThru [<SwitchParameter>]] [-WhatIf [<SwitchParameter>]] [<CommonParameters>]

<CommonParameters> This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).
The Android policy name.
The Android group name to link to.
If specified will write true in case operation succeeds. This parameter is optional. Default value is false.
The Android policy name.
The Android group name to link to.
If specified will write true in case operation succeeds. This parameter is optional. Default value is false.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Add (link) a user Group to the Android Policy --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: After logging-in as a valid Intune Account, when this command is executed, this will add (link) the specified group to the Android Policy. After the command is executed, it will display the status.
If any parameters are wrong, it will display "BadRequest" error message.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet to get Apps for Android platform.
Cmdlet to get apps for Android platform.
SYNTAX Get-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMApp [-InformationAction <ActionPreference>] [-InformationVariable <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

<CommonParameters> This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get the list of all MAM Android Apps --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $apps = Get-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMApp; $apps;

dev:remarks.maml:para: After logging-in as a valid Intune Account, when this command is executed, this will show the list of all MAM Android Apps. In this example we have a single App for the logged in account.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet to get existing Android Intune MAM Policy.
Cmdlet to get existing Android Intune MAM Policy.
SYNTAX Get-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicy [-Name <String>] [-InformationAction <ActionPreference>] [-InformationVariable <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

<CommonParameters> This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).
The policy name to fetch.
The policy name to fetch.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get all Intune Android MAM Policies --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
# Create a new Android Policy $p = New-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicy -FriendlyName AndroidTestPolicy
# Now get it $policies = Get-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicy
# Display it. $policies

dev:remarks.maml:para: After logging-in as a valid Intune Account, when this command is executed, this will get all the Android MAM policies for the logged in account.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Get a single Intune Android MAM Policy --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
# Create a new Android Policy $p = New-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicy -FriendlyName AndroidTestPolicy
# Now get it $policy = Get-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicy -Name $p.Name
# Display it. $policy

dev:remarks.maml:para: After logging-in as a valid Intune Account, when this command is executed, this will get the Android MAM policy matching the specified Name for the logged in account.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet to get existing Apps associated to Android Intune MAM policy Azure resource.
Cmdlet to get existing apps associated to Android Intune MAM policy Azure resource.
SYNTAX Get-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicyApp -Name <String> [-InformationAction <ActionPreference>] [-InformationVariable <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

<CommonParameters> This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).
The policy name for the apps to fetch.
The policy name for the apps to fetch.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get the Android Apps linked to the Android Policy --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: After logging-in as a valid Intune Account, when this command is executed, this will show the linked Android Apps to the Android Policy.
If any parameters are wrong, it will display "BadRequest" error message.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet to get existing Groups associated to Android Intune MAM policy Azure resource.
Cmdlet to get existing groups associated to Android Intune MAM policy Azure resource.
SYNTAX Get-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicyGroup -Name <String> [-InformationAction <ActionPreference>] [-InformationVariable <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

<CommonParameters> This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).
The policy name to fetch for the groups.
The policy name to fetch for the groups.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get the Groups linked to the Android Policy --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
# First create the policy $p = New-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicy -FriendlyName AndroidTestPolicy
# Get the list of AAD groups $groups = @(Get-AzureRmADGroup);
# Now add the Group to the Android policy. Add-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicyGroup -Name $p.Name -GroupName $groups[0].Id
# Get the linked groups $groups = Get-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicyGroup -Name $p.Name $groups

dev:remarks.maml:para: After logging-in as a valid Intune Account, when this command is executed, this will show the linked groups to the Android Policy.
If any parameters are wrong, it will display "BadRequest" error message.

Cmdlet to get existing apps associated to iOS Intune MAM policy Azure resource.

<CommonParameters> This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get the list of all MAM iOS Apps --------------------------

# First create the policy $p = New-AzureRmIntuneiOSMAMPolicy -FriendlyName iOSTestPolicy

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet to get the flagged MAM users.
Cmdlet to get the flagged MAM users.
The flagged user name to fetch.
The flagged user name to fetch.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get all flagged MAM users --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmIntuneMAMFlaggedUser

dev:remarks.maml:para: After logging-in as a valid Intune Account, when this command is executed, this will give the list of all the flagged MAM users.

ErrorCount : 1 FriendlyName : user1 Id : /providers/Microsoft.Intune/locations/fef.bmsua01/flaggedUsers/f4058390-f6d0-459b-9c36-3cf9d88e87f5 Name : f4058390-f6d0-459b-9c36-3cf9d88e87f5 Type : Microsoft.Intune/locations/flaggedUsers Tags : Location :

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Get a single flagged MAM user --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmIntuneMAMFlaggedUser -Name f4058390-f6d0-459b-9c36-3cf9d88e87f5

dev:remarks.maml:para: After logging-in as a valid Intune Account, when this command is executed, this will give a single flagged MAM users matching a given name.
If the user does not exist, it will return an invalid status code 'NotFound'.

ErrorCount : 1 FriendlyName : user1 Id : /providers/Microsoft.Intune/locations/fef.bmsua01/flaggedUsers/f4058390-f6d0-459b-9c36-3cf9d88e87f5 Name : f4058390-f6d0-459b-9c36-3cf9d88e87f5 Type : Microsoft.Intune/locations/flaggedUsers Tags : Location :

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet to get the MAM summary status
Cmdlet to get the MAM summary status

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get the MAM summary status --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmIntuneMAMStatus

dev:remarks.maml:para: The command gets the Summary status for the logged-in Intune MAM user.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet to get Devices for MAM User.
Cmdlet to get Devices for MAM User.
The name of the user to fetch the devices for.
The device name for the user to fetch.
The name of the user to fetch the devices for.
The device name for the user to fetch.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get all devices for a given MAM user --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
# Get the list of AAD users $users = @(Get-AzureRmADUser);
# Now get the devices for the user Get-AzureRmIntuneMAMUserDevice -Name $users[0].Id

dev:remarks.maml:para: After logging-in as a valid Intune Account, when this command is executed, this will give the list of all the devices for the MAM user specified by the "Name" parameter, which is mandatory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Get a single device for a given MAM user --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: After logging-in as a valid Intune Account, when this command is executed, this will return a single device specified with the "DeviceName" parameter for the MAM user specified by the "Name" parameter. Name is mandatory.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet to get the flagged enrolled Apps for the MAM User.
Cmdlet to get the flagged enrolled Apps for the MAM User.
The flagged user name to fetch the enrolled Apps for.
The flagged user name to fetch the enrolled Apps for.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get all flagged enrolled Apps --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: After logging-in as a valid Intune Account, when this command is executed, this will give the list of all the flagged enrolled apps for the MAM user specified by the "Name" parameter, which is mandatory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Get a single flagged enrolled App --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Not supported yet!

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet to get existing Operation results.
Cmdlet to get existing Operation results.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get all OperationResults --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-AzureRmIntuneOperationResult

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command should be executed after any long running operation is triggered. One such example is Invoke-AzureRmIntuneMAMUserDeviceWipe.
After logging-in as a valid Intune Account, when this command is executed, this will give the list of all the OperationResults.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Get all OperationResults --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Not supported yet.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet to Invoke user device wipe operation.
Cmdlet to Invoke user device wipe operation.
The User name(Unique Id) for whom the device should be wiped.
The device Name for which to invoke wipe.
Don't ask for confirmation.
The User name(Unique Id) for whom the device should be wiped.
The device Name for which to invoke wipe.
Don't ask for confirmation.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Wipe a given Device for a given MAM user --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
# Get the list of AAD users $users = @(Get-AzureRmADUser);
# Get the list of devices for a given user specified by Name parameter $devices = Get-AzureRmIntuneMAMUserDevice -Name $users[0].Id
#Wipe the first device from the list. $wipeResult = Invoke-AzureRmIntuneMAMUserDeviceWipe -Name $users[0].Id -DeviceName $devices[0].Name
#display the wipe result $wipeResult

dev:remarks.maml:para: After logging-in as a valid Intune Account, when this command is executed, this will issue the wipe coomand for the apps on the specified device. Wipe is a long running operation, and the output of the invoke call will show the path to the OperationResults, which will provide the status of the wipe action overtime.

maml:description.maml:para: A cmdlet that creates a new Android Intune MAM policy Azure resource.
A cmdlet that creates a new Android Intune MAM policy Azure resource.

SYNTAX New-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicy -FriendlyName <String> [-Description <String>] [-AppSharingFromLevel <AppSharingType>] [-AppSharingToLevel <AppSharingType>] [-Authentication <ChoiceType>] [-ClipboardSharingLevel <ClipboardSharingLevelType>] [-DataBackup <FilterType>] [-FileSharingSaveAs <FilterType>] [-Pin <ChoiceType>] [-PinNumRetry <[Int32]>] [-DeviceCompliance <OptionType>] [-ManagedBrowser <ChoiceType>] [-AccessRecheckOfflineTimeout <[Int32]>] [-AccessRecheckOnlineTimeout <[Int32]>] [-OfflineWipeTimeout <[Int32]>] [-FileEncryption <ChoiceType>] [-ScreenCapture <FilterType>] [-InformationAction <ActionPreference>] [-InformationVariable <String>] [-WhatIf [<SwitchParameter>]] [<CommonParameters>]

<CommonParameters> This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).
The policy friendly name.
The policy description.

Indicates whether the application is allowed to receive information shared by other applications. Information can be restricted to no applications, only managed applications, or be allowed from all applications.
Indicates whether the application is allowed to share information with other applications. Information can be shared with no applications, only managed applications, or shared to all applications.
Indicates whether corporate credentials are required to access the application.
Indicates whether to restrict cut, copy and paste with other applications.
Indicates whether to prevent iTunes and iCloud backups.
Indicates whether to prevent ‘Save As’ from the application.
Indicates whether simple PIN is required to access the application.
When a simple PIN is required to access the application, this indicates the number of attempts before a PIN reset.
Indicates whether managed applications are blocked from running on rooted or jailbroken devices.
Indicates whether web content from the application is forced to run in the managed browser.
Indicates how long to wait in minutes before re-checking access requirements on the device if the device is offline.
Indicates how long to wait in minutes before re-checking access requirements on the device.
Indicates the number of days a device must be offline before application data is automatically wiped.
Indicates whether to encrypt application data.
Indicates whether screen capture is allowed for the application.
The policy friendly name.
The policy description.

Indicates whether the application is allowed to receive information shared by other applications. Information can be restricted to no applications, only managed applications, or be allowed from all applications.
Indicates whether the application is allowed to share information with other applications. Information can be shared with no applications, only managed applications, or shared to all applications.
Indicates whether corporate credentials are required to access the application.
Indicates whether to restrict cut, copy and paste with other applications.
Indicates whether to prevent iTunes and iCloud backups.
Indicates whether to prevent ‘Save As’ from the application.
Indicates whether simple PIN is required to access the application.
When a simple PIN is required to access the application, this indicates the number of attempts before a PIN reset.
Indicates whether managed applications are blocked from running on rooted or jailbroken devices.
Indicates whether web content from the application is forced to run in the managed browser.
Indicates how long to wait in minutes before re-checking access requirements on the device if the device is offline.
Indicates how long to wait in minutes before re-checking access requirements on the device.
Indicates the number of days a device must be offline before application data is automatically wiped.
Indicates whether to encrypt application data.
Indicates whether screen capture is allowed for the application.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create a new IntuneAndroidMAMPolicy --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$p = New-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicy -FriendlyName AndroidTestPolicy
# Display the newly created policy $p

dev:remarks.maml:para: After logging-in as a valid Intune Account, when this command is executed, this will create a new IntuneAndroidMAMPolicy. When an optional parameter is not passed, the default value is used during the creation of the policy.

maml:description.maml:para: A cmdlet that creates a new iOS Intune MAM policy azure resource.

<CommonParameters> This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).
The policy friendly name.
The policy description.

Indicates whether the application is allowed to receive information shared by other applications. Information can be restricted to no applications, only managed applications, or be allowed from all applications.
Indicates whether the application is allowed to share information with other applications. Information can be shared with no applications, only managed applications, or shared to all applications.
Indicates whether corporate credentials are required to access the application.
Indicates whether to restrict cut, copy and paste with other applications.
Indicates whether to prevent iTunes and iCloud backups.
Indicates whether to prevent ‘Save As’ from the application.

When a simple PIN is required to access the application, this indicates the number of attempts before a PIN reset.
Indicates whether managed applications are blocked from running on rooted or jailbroken devices.
Indicates whether web content from the application is forced to run in the managed browser.
Indicates how long to wait in minutes before re-checking access requirements on the device if the device is offline.
Indicates how long to wait in minutes before re-checking access requirements on the device.
Indicates the number of days a device must be offline before application data is automatically wiped.
Indicates whether fingerprints are allowed instead of PIN to access the application.
Indicates whether fingerprints are allowed instead of PIN to access the application.

The policy description.

Indicates whether the application is allowed to receive information shared by other applications. Information can be restricted to no applications, only managed applications, or be allowed from all applications.

command:example.dev:code:
$p = New-AzureRmIntuneiOSMAMPolicy -FriendlyName iOSTestPolicy
# Display the newly created policy $p

maml:description.maml:para: A cmdlet that removes Intune Andriod MAM Policy.
A cmdlet that removes Intune Andriod MAM Policy.

SYNTAX Remove-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicy -Name <String> [-Force [<SwitchParameter>]] [-PassThru [<SwitchParameter>]] [-InformationAction <ActionPreference>] [-InformationVariable <String>] [-WhatIf [<SwitchParameter>]] [-Confirm [<SwitchParameter>]] [<CommonParameters>]

<CommonParameters> This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).
The Android Policy Name (Policy Guid) to remove the policy.
If set to true, don't ask for confirmation.
If specified will write true in case operation succeeds. This parameter is optional. Default value is false.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Remove an Intune Android MAM Policy --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
# First create the policy $p = New-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicy -FriendlyName AndroidTestPolicy -Force
# Now remove the policy Remove-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicy -Name $p.Name -Force

dev:remarks.maml:para: After logging-in as a valid Intune Account, when this command is executed, this will delete the policy specified by Name parameter.

maml:description.maml:para: A cmdlet to remove a linked App from Android Intune MAM policy Azure resource.
A cmdlet to remove a linked app from Android Intune MAM policy Azure resource.

SYNTAX Remove-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicyApp -Name <String> -AppName <String> [-Force [<SwitchParameter>]] [-PassThru [<SwitchParameter>]] [-InformationAction <ActionPreference>] [-InformationVariable <String>] [-WhatIf [<SwitchParameter>]] [-Confirm [<SwitchParameter>]] [<CommonParameters>]

<CommonParameters> This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Remove the link to an Android App from a Intune Android MAM Policy --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: # First create the policy $p = New-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicy -FriendlyName AndroidTestPolicy
# Get the list of apps $apps = Get-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMApp;
# Link the app to the Android Policy Add-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicyApp -Name $p.name -AppName $apps[0].Name;
# Now remove the link. Remove-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicyApp -Name $p.name -AppName $apps[0].Name -Force;
After logging-in as a valid Intune Account, when this command is executed, this will remove the link to an App specified by AppName parameter from a policy specified by Name parameter.

maml:description.maml:para: A cmdlet that edits an existing Android Intune MAM policy.
A cmdlet that edits an existing Android Intune MAM policy.

SYNTAX Set-AzureRmIntuneAndroidMAMPolicy -Name <String> [-FriendlyName <String>] [-Description <String>] [-AppSharingFromLevel <[AppSharingType]>] [-AppSharingToLevel <[AppSharingType]>] [-Authentication <[ChoiceType]>] [-ClipboardSharingLevel <[ClipboardSharingLevelType]>] [-DataBackup <[FilterType]>] [-FileSharingSaveAs <[FilterType]>] [-Pin <[ChoiceType]>] [-PinNumRetry <[Int32]>] [-DeviceCompliance <[OptionType]>] [-ManagedBrowser <[ChoiceType]>] [-AccessRecheckOfflineTimeout <[Int32]>] [-AccessRecheckOnlineTimeout <[Int32]>] [-OfflineWipeTimeout <[Int32]>] [-FileEncryption <[ChoiceType]>] [-ScreenCapture <[FilterType]>] [-Force [<SwitchParameter>]] [-InformationAction <ActionPreference>] [-InformationVariable <String>] [-WhatIf [<SwitchParameter>]] [-Confirm [<SwitchParameter>]] [<CommonParameters>]

<CommonParameters> This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).
The policy name to patch.
The policy friendly name.
The policy description.

Indicates whether the application is allowed to receive information shared by other applications. Information can be restricted to no applications, only managed applications, or be allowed from all applications.
Indicates whether the application is allowed to share information with other applications. Information can be shared with no applications, only managed applications, or shared to all applications.
Indicates whether corporate credentials are required to access the application.
Indicates whether to restrict cut, copy and paste with other applications.
Indicates whether to prevent iTunes and iCloud backups.
Indicates whether to prevent ‘Save As’ from the application.
Indicates whether simple PIN is required to access the application.
When a simple PIN is required to access the application, this indicates the number of attempts before a PIN reset.
Indicates whether managed applications are blocked from running on rooted or jailbroken devices.
Indicates whether web content from the application is forced to run in the managed browser.
Indicates how long to wait in minutes before re-checking access requirements on the device if the device is offline.
Indicates how long to wait in minutes before re-checking access requirements on the device.
Indicates the number of days a device must be offline before application data is automatically wiped.
Indicates whether to encrypt application data.
Indicates whether screen capture is allowed for the application.
If set to true, don't ask for confirmation.
The policy name to patch.
The policy friendly name.
The policy description.

Indicates whether the application is allowed to receive information shared by other applications. Information can be restricted to no applications, only managed applications, or be allowed from all applications.
Indicates whether the application is allowed to share information with other applications. Information can be shared with no applications, only managed applications, or shared to all applications.
Indicates whether corporate credentials are required to access the application.
Indicates whether to restrict cut, copy and paste with other applications.
Indicates whether to prevent iTunes and iCloud backups.
Indicates whether to prevent ‘Save As’ from the application.
Indicates whether simple PIN is required to access the application.
When a simple PIN is required to access the application, this indicates the number of attempts before a PIN reset.
Indicates whether managed applications are blocked from running on rooted or jailbroken devices.
Indicates whether web content from the application is forced to run in the managed browser.
Indicates how long to wait in minutes before re-checking access requirements on the device if the device is offline.
Indicates how long to wait in minutes before re-checking access requirements on the device.
Indicates the number of days a device must be offline before application data is automatically wiped.
Indicates whether to encrypt application data.
Indicates whether screen capture is allowed for the application.
If set to true, don't ask for confirmation.
